hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ayyub: Said ibn Jubayr was asked about dyeing with wasm (indigo plant), so he disliked it, and he said: Allah clothes the servant with light in his face, then extinguishes it with blackness.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ismail ibn Abd al-Malik: I saw on Said ibn Jubayr a white turban. Also narrated: al-Fadl ibn Dukain informed us, Umar ibn Dharr said: I heard my father saying: Indeed Said ibn Jubayr used to enter the sacred state (ihram) in a decorated tayyalsan. Umar said: And my father used to enter the sacred state in a decorated tayyalsan.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Burdah: My father sent me to Abdullah ibn Salam to learn from him. I came to him, and he asked me: Who are you? I informed him, and he welcomed me. I said: My father sent me to you to ask you and learn from you. He said: O son of my brother, you are in a land of merchants. If you have a debt over someone, and he gifts you a load of straw, do not accept it, for it is riba (usury).

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Burdah: I arrived in Madinah and met Abdullah ibn Salam. He said: Will you not enter a house that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ entered, and pray in a house where the Messenger of Allah ﷺ prayed, and we will feed you dates and sweet drink (sawiq)? He said: And Abdullah ibn Salam said: O son of my brother, you are in a land where riba is prevalent and concealed. Is it not that when one of you gives a loan and then it is repaid, the creditor comes with a load of food and a load of fodder? That is usury.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated that Abu Wa'il and Abu Burdah were in charge of the treasury. It is also said that Abu Burdah assumed the position of judge (qadi) of Kufa after Shurayh. Also narrated: I saw Abu Burdah riding on a she-camel with a Quran hung in front of the she-camel.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ghannam ibn Talq: I witnessed Abu Burdah ibn Abi Musa attend the funeral of a freed slave who died, and he put the neighborhood imam ahead of him. Muhammad ibn Sa'd said: Muhammad ibn Umar said: Abu Burdah narrated from his father, and he was a judge of Kufa. Muhammad ibn Umar and others said: Abu Burdah died in Kufa in the year 103 (AH).
